description: Students delve further into the topics of kinetics, thermodynamics and atomic and molecular
structure that were introduced in the first-year courses. This course emphasizes the
mathematical aspects of chemistry. Specific topics may include reaction mechanisms,
homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis, phase transitions, macromolecules, symmetry,
spectroscopy and molecular orbital theory. Prerequisite: Chemistry 126. Previous completion of
Physics 124 or 126 is recommended. Concurrent registration in Chemistry 357 is required.
